ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Privacy law and lack thereof, a lot of fun facts about Brad
Learned a lot about privacy through a legal lens.
Debating, communicating and challenging my thoughts and intuitions just figuring out what I actually think about privacy and my own boundaries
Fascinating class on first, fourth, fifth amendment and developing my understanding of what exactly is considered private
Everyone knows this course is the best. If youre considering bud not sure just do it. You wont be disappointed.
Gained insight into the concept of privacy both from legal and technological perspectives, and how the law / tech intersection complicates privacy in the digital age.
Learned a ton that I didnt know about control tech and privacy
Basic understanding of privacy law, increased understanding of the present state and progress of surveillance technology, increased comfort with reading court cases.

Learned so much about the legal derivation of privacy from different angles. Lots of truly fun case review as with the previous class, even from a non-law background. Feels more relevant every day with new technologies.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I loved this class
Its awesome. Take it.
Amazing course  taught in such a great way by a great professor

I love this course. It was so much fun each week. There are some times when I had trouble articulating the main idea of a class, possibly because of the free-flowing structure of the class, but Brad usually does state main takeaways pretty explicitly, so that may be just a me problem.
Brad strength, weakness is little feedback but you learn a ton you know why youre here

If anything for improvement, I'm just sad how fast the class was over. This class was really one of my favorite times at Yale and I'm not super sure how to improve it. Maybe some briefing on each of the following week's readings at the end of each class?

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: yes
YES! JUST DO IT!
Yes! Brad is amazing, great prof and the course is very interesting
Absolutely
110%, excellent excellent class
Yes obviously. Brad is the best and we grapple with problems that actually affect people day to day.
Yes definitely
I would recommend this class, especially if you enjoyed CPSC 183 / 184 and are looking to continue learning more about the intersection of law and technology in a seminar format.

Absolutely. The style/spirit of the course isn't for everyone, but I would recommend to most people that they should try it, and I loved it. Also, the topics are extremely important, and it's one of the most contemporarily relevant classes I've taken.
Yes, take it

I really loved everything about this course. Brad is an incredible teacher who integrates readings so closely to interesting stories. He can make even the driest legal text captivating, and thus, easy to memorize and carry with you. I'm confident I'll remember this class more than just about any other years down the line. Thank you Brad!
